TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebHttpSecurity extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies the types of security available to a service endpoint configured to receive HTTP requests.

remarks.format:
## Remarks WebHttpSecurity provides the security requirements for an endpoint configured with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property become effective for the service endpoint. The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> can only be set in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> constructor that takes it as an explicit parameter and its value cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.

Gets or sets the mode of security that is used by an endpoint configured to receive HTTP requests with a .
Docs.value: A value of the that indicates whether transport-level security or no security is used by an endpoint. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property determines whether the settings from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property becomes effective.

Docs.exception: The value is not a valid .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeTransport() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the Transport property has changed from its default value and should be serialized. This is used by WCF for XAML integration.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property value should be serialized; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets an object that contains the transport-level security settings for this binding.
Docs.value:
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> for this binding.
The default values set are a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ClientCredentialType%2A> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ProxyCredentialType%2A> of , and <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.Realm%2A> = "".

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> object returned by this property to set the transport security parameters for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the Transport property become effective for the service endpoint.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the Transport property become effective for the service endpoint. The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> can only be set in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> constructor that takes it as an explicit parameter and its value cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.
